intro: Schizolegnia javanensis, commonly known as the Javanese schizolegnia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Schizolegnia javanensis is often found in tropical rainforests, growing in shaded, humid environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
